item.title: If Vladimir Putin has to destroy cities like Kyiv and Kharkiv in order to impose a puppet government on Ukraine, he will in an important sense have already lost the war https://t.co/421emTzYGB
As a member of NATO, Poland now seems like a safe haven for Ukrainians. Any attack on it by Russia would trigger the alliance’s mutual-defence provisions https://t.co/4vBdMjsAgZ

Russia’s immense armed forces have yet to win control of a single major urban area. Ukrainians have defended their homeland ferociously. Our reporters sum up day five of the conflict https://t.co/nc9Ag3SWuZ
Some half a million people have already left Ukraine since the war began, according to the UN https://t.co/dNcd0X12Ve
The Russian war machine is struggling. The question is whether these troubles are temporary or indicate a deeper rot that Ukraine can exploit https://t.co/zzP5UpzETq
We found anti-war posts coming from Russia’s 50 largest cities, across all 11 time zones and in 83 out of 85 federal subjects https://t.co/BWsMCcF3OV
Among the men deploying to defend Kyiv, morale is sky-high. Our reporters, in both the capital and in Kharkiv, report on the events of day five of the conflict https://t.co/UAMtoo30d2
Russian aggression is prompting rare unity and severe reprisals https://t.co/CuNMRmxQNv
This is the kind of refugee crisis that Europe hoped never to see again https://t.co/RxsqtzVlmY

Unlike Vladminir Putin, Volodymyr Zelensky is fighting for his country not in the name of a dark imperial fantasy, but out of the conviction that Ukraine is sovereign and independent https://t.co/s7hcMAQVXK
The more people suspect what is really happening, the more brutally Vladimir Putin may treat those who tell the truth about what he is doing to Ukraine, and to Russia https://t.co/eDmGtIkmCd
The bulk of Russian forces are now 25km from the centre of Kyiv, the capital, and will probably encircle it in the coming days https://t.co/hT1PyWHaDe
The bulk of Russian forces are within 25km of Kyiv. They may try to encircle it within days. This map shows how troops have advanced https://t.co/PSl2FIPOrE

Since the end of the cold war Germany has vexed successive American presidents by failing to meet NATO’s military spending target of 2% of GDP for European members. But Mr Scholz called for Germany to make an investment greater than that “from now on” https://t.co/BAgi0pHBDA
Our data journalists identified the geolocation of 7,120 social-media protest posts, of which 3,495 were marked as from within Russia https://t.co/KiqxQe1IEG
Russia’s failure to take Kharkiv has bolstered Ukrainian morale as fighting continues in Kyiv https://t.co/GDwmMSASDj
It is not clear how long Russians will believe what their televisions are telling them. Actors, businessfolk and even some politicians are starting to speak out https://t.co/HDqQicApRX
The West’s deployment of this economic weapon will also be watched with slack-jawed shock in China, which has $3.4trn of reserves https://t.co/zS3GZLqOwm
On Instagram, some 50,000 pictures with the anti-war hashtag were posted between Saturday and Sunday alone and now total over 330,000 https://t.co/QVnhLO5bxp
Just as Vladimir Putin has made himself a pariah by invading the country next door, so Russia’s economy could end up being isolated, too https://t.co/i7WWeuX96p
Ukraine’s president is fast becoming a hero. We revisit @1843mag’s profile of the actor-turned politician https://t.co/TIgfdZnBuW
The Ukrainian government sees the value of surviving even if Kyiv, the capital, falls. To that end it has dispersed ministers around the country and beyond https://t.co/K0T7BxJwcS
How Volodymr Zelensky found his roar https://t.co/q25rVdmjBa
Volodymyr Zelensky is driven neither by nationalism nor ideology. Nor is he a revolutionary. He is Everyman https://t.co/1QB9N43P3B
Any ban on foreign investors from getting out their money could sour what little is left of Russia’s reputation as an investment destination https://t.co/gCbgElxdYv
He has carried himself with dignity, strength and a dash of humour https://t.co/CWgkM4hErj
Despite being outgunned and outnumbered, Ukraine reportedly inflicted more casualties in 24 hours than Russia suffered over eight years of engagements in Syria https://t.co/zI9EF5bpgB
When trouble struck, you followed the Japanese money. This has not worked so reliably lately. Might the yen’s safe-haven status soon be restored? https://t.co/bnTndiytw8

It is impossible to gauge the durability of the global reaction, from the rare American political consensus in support of the Biden administration’s policy to NATO’s concerted action https://t.co/ZqLZxviV0i
The Russian invasion of Ukraine is not going to plan. The president has made three key mistakes https://t.co/GZiajvFsyM

On paper, Ukraine’s military budget is smaller than that of city-state Singapore. But nominal spending figures dramatically understate some countries’ capabilities.
Learn why the military gap between Russia and Ukraine is not as wide as it may appear ⬇️
Uruguay boasts Latin America’s largest middle class. It has the region’s highest income per capita and has more or less eliminated extreme poverty https://t.co/7oZZ5915H8
Europe’s best hope to get hold of enough liquefied natural gas would be to buy existing LNG cargoes destined for elsewhere https://t.co/FziQZ09lYr

♦️ Ukrainian and Russian negotiators sat down for talks after Ukraine said it wants an immediate ceasefire.
♦️ America blocked all American transactions with Russia’s central bank.
♦️ Volodymyr Zelensky asked the EU to immediately admit Ukraine as a member.
Stay up to date👇

When Vladimir Putin invaded Ukraine he miscalculated. Now that he is wielding the threat of nuclear war, the world must make clear that his actions are unacceptable. He must not miscalculate again https://t.co/5392ZsohL6

We are following the war between Russia and Ukraine closely.
Learn what’s at stake and what might happen next ⬇️

Vladimir Putin’s nuclear threat shows how much is going wrong for him in Ukraine. Why won't Russia leave its neighbour alone?
Read our latest analysis on the invasion: https://t.co/Ku48sueqh2 https://t.co/5l20toKu1Q
Ukraine has come together after the invasion. Volodymyr Zelensky is as much inspired by the spirit of his people as he inspires them https://t.co/fGWxdpeVJ8
Inspired by Ukrainian courage and urged on by their own citizens, Western governments have at last found the will to impose harsh sanctions https://t.co/SOuNtL3q7s

Russia is estimated to have 1,588 deployed nuclear warheads and 2,889 in reserve (America has 1,644 and 1,964 respectively). Its “deterrence forces” are not just nuclear ones, though https://t.co/dRYmmDN9Lw
On both sides of the Atlantic foreign-policy analysts expressed astonishment at the swiftness and severity of the international response https://t.co/ceZc8ksuS0
The currency has slumped. Interest rates have risen from 9.5% to 20%. Capital controls may follow. It shows how isolated Russia has become https://t.co/4wUy46arqV

If Vladimir Putin is to hold on to the Kremlin after a failed or drawn-out war in Ukraine, he may be obliged to impose terror of a severity that Russia has not seen for decades https://t.co/cH6dRIcyER
Europe realises that being in the proverbial peloton has its limitations. But to be a leader requires resources and purpose https://t.co/WUECzkiROg

Unlike Vladimir Putin, Volodymyr Zelensky is fighting for his country not in the name of a dark imperial fantasy, but out of the conviction that Ukraine is sovereign and independent https://t.co/PFeNZnIwem
